organic_results.title: Classroom racial balance and students' interracial attitudes
organic_results.snippet: Relationships between classroom racial balance and third graders' interracial attitudes were analyzed. Students took three attitude tests designed to measure different components of interracial attitudes. On all measures, interracial attitudes were more favorable in balanced than in unbalanced classes. Students in balanced classes showed less racial polarization in teacher and classmate preferences and named more other-race peers as friends than did students in unbalanced classes. The social distances which children ascribed to figures …
